H0.text: The Jurassic period is known for the appearance on earth of what. Ancient Trees

H1.text: The Jurassic period is known for the appearance on earth of what. Early Mammals

H2.text: The Jurassic period is known for the appearance on earth of what. Giant Insects

H3.text: The Jurassic period is known for the appearance on earth of what. Dinosur

A4.text: Dinosaurs diverged from their archosaur ancestors during the Middle to Late Triassic epochs, roughly 20 million years after the devastating Permian–Triassic extinction event wiped out an estimated 96% of all marine species and 70% of terrestrial vertebrate species approximately 252 million years ago.

A5.text: The first few lines of early dinosaurs diversified through the Carnian and Norian stages of the Triassic, possibly by occupying the niches of the groups that became extinct.

A6.text: Two New Species of Large Predatory Dinosaur With Crocodile-Like Skulls Discovered on Isle of Wight

A7.text: Mammaliaformes, including mammals, having originated from cynodonts at the end of the Triassic, diversified extensively during the Jurassic.

A8.text: Dinosaurs, which had morphologically diversified in the Late Triassic, experienced a major increase in diversity and abundance during the Early Jurassic in the aftermath of the end‑Triassic extinction and the extinction of other reptile groups, becoming the dominant vertebrates in terrestrial ecosystems.
